website_summaries.verdict: This can opener quickly and easily removes can lids without you ever needing to touch the can.
pros: Automatically locks onto the can and stays put when in use
Remove lid using the can opener and throw it in the trash with the push of a button
cons: Some users say the grip has an awkward feel to it when turning the crank

customer_reviews.title: I was very pleased with this one's performance for the first few months
customer_reviews.text: I wanted a fancy can opener for a long time--one that wouldn't rust and that would leave a safe edge. I was very pleased with this one's performance for the first few months. The locking mechanism on the can opener (instead of the traditional squeeze shut to connect the blades to the can) is enabled by turning the knob which is also used to open the can: it first locks on to the can and then unscrews the can. It unlocks by turning the knob in the reverse direction. After a few months of use, the lock mechanism will no longer engage when turned, and the product is now nonfunctional.
customer_reviews.author: Responsible Online Citizen

customer_reviews.title: Great can opener. Almost as good as the OXO Good Grips Smooth Edge Can Opener.
customer_reviews.text: We own an OXO Good Grips Smooth Edge Can Opener, and since it is several years old and starting to wear out, I ordered the Kuhn Rikon as an eventual replacement, and to test it out of curiosity. The Kuhn Rikon is much sharper, and does a very neat job cutting the lid. That said, I must admit that the OXO is much easier and more comfortable to operate with its big rubber grip that is offset and rotated 90 degrees. I don't think you'll go wrong buying this can opener or the OXO. At this point, though, I'd probably say the OXO wins by a nose. But we'll see how well the Kuhn Rikon wears over time.
customer_reviews.author: Brian W

customer_reviews.title: Leaves long shreds of sharp metal!
customer_reviews.text: We have had one of these can openers for years, but this new one leaves long ribbons of sharp metal around the rim of the can. Having been pricked by several and having found one IN our food I am throwing this new one away. Too late to return.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff H.

customer_reviews.title: Good points and bad
customer_reviews.text: It does do a lot. The feature to twist off bottle caps has not worked for me though. Just doesn’t grip the cap enough. The can opener is great. No sharp edges. The hooky thing to lift up tabs is great so I’m not ripping fingernails anymore. It is much bigger and glunkier than I expected. Takes up a fair bit of room in my utensil drawer. Can’t speak to durability yet as I only got it recently. Seems to be a sturdy plastic though.
customer_reviews.author: N. Reardon

customer_reviews.title: Dangerous Product!
customer_reviews.text: Produces dangerous slivers of metal when using the can opener. Also, I seem to be unable to remove the opener from the can when reversing direction. I have a Pampered Chef version (safety can opener) and have never experienced shards of metal. Returning.
customer_reviews.author: Sailorman

customer_reviews.title: Works well to open cans and bottles
customer_reviews.text: I like this can opener so far. It's working well and while it's rather long, it isn't too bulky in my gadget drawer. I have used it to open cans, pop tops and soda bottles. I could not get it to release the vacuum on a glass jar though. That would have earned it 5 stars. The plastic bit intended for that job just seems too bulky or not long enough to get under the jar lid and still have enough leverage to pry it. I have not tried the beer bottle opener tool on it.
customer_reviews.author: JAN

customer_reviews.title: Stays clean, no rust.
customer_reviews.text: The only clean can opener we have, very easy to use. Not like any traditional can openers.
customer_reviews.author: Sherry Jordan

customer_reviews.title: Great little tool!
customer_reviews.text: I've been wanting a safety can opener for awhile. I finally jumped at this one when I saw all the features!! This has a lot of handy perks that make it great for every household! I did a youtube search just to see exactly how to use it before it arrived. You don't hold it sideways like a traditional opener, it goes on the top. I find the strength needed to open the can is the same as a regular opener. And probably my favorite part, it doesn't get yucky!! The opener doesn't touch the food inside, so there's nothing to rinse or wash after use! I'd recommend this opener to anyone! Just try it!
customer_reviews.author: mizheidi

customer_reviews.title: It's Huge and Goofy Looking
customer_reviews.text: Our old KitchenAid can opener gave it up after only a few years, and we decided to try a side-cut opener. My wife likes red so I ordered this one. It was way way bigger than I expected when it arrived, and it's still a bit hard to get into the kitchen gadget drawer. But it works great. Being big makes it easier to hold. The side cut works great and I like not having the sharp edges. Maybe next time I won't get the extra-huge version with the bottle opener and pick built-in, but this has been holding so well that I may not be replacing it for a long time.
customer_reviews.author: StSky

customer_reviews.title: DON"T BUY THIS!
customer_reviews.text: I thought this was going to be the answer for my aging hands when opening cans and two liter bottles. It doesn't open cans from Aldi's where we purchase most of our groceries. It will NOT open two liter pop bottles. The only thing I use it for is opening tabs on pop cans. This was a huge disappointment. I should have returned it.
customer_reviews.author: Cookalagoonga

customer_reviews.title: Opens cans easily with no sharp edge and no need to pry partially cut lids ever again.
customer_reviews.text: The first time you use this can opener it seems like you don't know what you're doing. As you're opening the can it doesn't seem as if anything is happening. However once you've made the full circle around the can and pop the lid off you are amazed at the result. The only issue with this can opener is that I was so used to the other style of can opener I didn't recognize how it worked. Absolutely the best opening system for a can that I've ever seen. After the first can, you wonder why we haven't been opening cans like this forever. Clearly a superior product.
customer_reviews.author: DH.

customer_reviews.title: Not a Must Have But a Nice to Have Tool!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this device for my Mother who has difficulty with tight-fitting jars/bottles as well as concerns about potentially being cut while opening cans with a pull ring. I can’t attest to the other features this device has but the pull ring hook opener worked amazingly well. Very easy to open this type of can with very little effort. I’m a bit concerned that it’s manufactured in China but I’ll be keeping an eye on its durability. The instructions that came with this device was very brief. A little more detailed instructions would have been helpful.
customer_reviews.author: MJD

customer_reviews.title: Its a really neet can opener
customer_reviews.text: I mean, it's a can opener - but it is really neat! It feels like quality in the hand, and once you figure out how to use it, it's so nice! No more accidentally cutting yourself on sharp can edges - they come out perfectly rounded every time. Highly recommended for gadget geeks or anyone who has to open a lot of cans and might be a klutz!
customer_reviews.author: Anthony I.

customer_reviews.title: Every Kitchen needs this
customer_reviews.text: What else can be said about the master opener other than WOW!!!! This thing is great... opening cans to jars to beer bottles all in one thoughtfully designed piece. The Kuhn Rik-on has come in handy on countless occasions. I feel like some one with a new cell phone, What did we do before this product was around. Yeah I know it may sound corny but it is true I'm not even getting paid for this review just straight to the point and from the heart. I would classify this as a super buy not only for the overall price but also for use and craftsmanship.
customer_reviews.author: Bruno PereiraTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Read the instructions and it’s easy!
customer_reviews.text: Once you get the hang of this (read the instructions), this is super easy to use. You don’t need the squeeze the handles together like my other can opener and it’s easy to twist the handle. A quick reverse twist releases the opener from the can. Pretty cool gadget!
customer_reviews.author: Krista and Aidan

customer_reviews.title: Teriffic can opener
customer_reviews.text: I've been using a manual Kuhn Rikon can opener for about 15 years and have pretty well worn it out. I just recently ordered one of these and am extremely happy at how well it works. It is easier to attach (almost automatically) and the lid lifter is much easier to use than my old one. The ergonomic design and incorporation of other opening mechanisms makes it very much a multi-functional kitchen tool. At this point, I can only hope it's as durable as my old one.
customer_reviews.author: sometimes traveler

customer_reviews.title: A must to have: the perfect can opener on earth!
customer_reviews.text: Easy, smart, functional,... This product was designed by a genius ! It’s a perfect can opener, with an amazing thing over all others: really secure! Impossible to be injured by the opened can! No risk of cut. It’s good for user, and it’s good for animals: they never be injured when they found cans in bin...
customer_reviews.author: Casouilline

customer_reviews.title: Finally!
customer_reviews.text: This is a big can opener which is a plus for me. It is comfortable to hold while opening cans, is easy to turn and it's nice not having sharp edges to get cut with and to be able to reuse the can if need be for grease etc. as others have stated. I've washed a few of the cans and stored them just knowing you can hide stuff in your pantry in plain sight. I have wasted money buying can openers at pretty much every store I've been into only to get home and they don't work and this one does work. Love it.
customer_reviews.author: P.

customer_reviews.title: Simply the Best Can Opener you will ever own.
customer_reviews.text: I found the “Mother of all Can Openers”, the Binford 5000 (patent pending). It opens cans, bottle caps, screw-cap bottles, Gatorade bottles, and pull-tab cans. You can use it left-handed, right-handed, and half-handed. It’s a Back Scratcher and a Head Scratcher all in one. Even Bush’s Grilling Bean cans tremble at the sight of this can opener.
customer_reviews.author: Mikey Likes It

customer_reviews.title: which is a much better design than was available in 2003
customer_reviews.text: I had a Rikon can opener I bought in 2003. I really preferred it to my old can opener. Lately I have had trouble opening certain brands of canned goods (looking at you Kirkland brand!), and thought that maybe the can opener had worn out after thirteen years...I ordered this one, which is a much better design than was available in 2003, and am so impressed with how beautifully it works that I bought additional ones to give to my kids. This is a wonderful tool.
customer_reviews.author: Janet Schmidt

customer_reviews.title: Really like this can opener!
customer_reviews.text: This product replaces several other devices and works great! There is a definite learning curve on how to get the feel of using it, but once you learn it, it's very easy. When I say "feel" I really mean "feel" since you cannot see if the opener is positioned correctly; you just have to feel the correct position. It's kind of like instinct, but I think your body just learns the correct position. Another bonus besides the smooth can edges it creates is that it's easier to turn than other manual can openers, which is a big plus for someone who hates to put unnecessary effort into anything.
customer_reviews.author: Twilla J

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic once you get used to it
customer_reviews.text: Can be a bit tricky the first time you use it but it's actually great. I've even seen others mention about splinters after using, i experienced this my first time too but have realized that it was due to my incorrect usage of the can opener. Once i re-read the instructions and was more careful i realized that this item is actually pretty awesome and have not had any negative issues anymore.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher S Guill

customer_reviews.title: Works well, love the ease of removing top of the can
customer_reviews.text: This is a very handy kitchen multi-tool. It opens cans as advertised and the cut lid and can are not sharp. Easy to use. The other things for prying off lids, opening bottles, pull taps on cans also work very well. It is a nifty tool that can make life easier and the kitchen. It has replaced 2 lesser can openers and has helped de-clutter one of the kitchen drawers. Score!!
customer_reviews.author: brooks w booker III

customer_reviews.title: My arthritic hands love it
customer_reviews.text: My arthritic hands love this can opener. It took a few tries to figure it out because frankly I'm not that smart (HA) but seriously this is so easy to use and I feel so much better knowing it's more sanitary and there are no more sharp edges!
customer_reviews.author: Kimmy Crush

customer_reviews.title: Best can/bottle opener ever!!!
customer_reviews.text: I had watched some late night sales pitch for these on one of the shopping channels and kept telling myself to buy one. Our can opener died and all the store had were the old fashioned ones. Found this one on Amazon and am so happy! I forgot that you can open pull tab lids, screw top bottles (which rip my skin off my fingers nowadays), and metal bottle tops besides safely opening cans and grabbing the lid to throw it away! Love this, bought two more in black for my parents for Christmas!
customer_reviews.author: jessnandy

customer_reviews.title: she'd seen one somewhere and liked it. As I researched it
customer_reviews.text: This is about the slickest, darn device I've ever purchased! My Mom asked for one for Christmas; she'd seen one somewhere and liked it. As I researched it; I decided to get one for myself as well. Boy, am I glad I did! I think we used all, 5 pieces of this opener on Christmas day alone! One drawback; if you open a can that needs the juice squeezed out; use your old can opener for that part, because the 'lid' that this opener creates, does not fit down inside the can to allow the squeezing. Otherwise; this thing is a gem and worth it's weight in gold! Get it!
customer_reviews.author: Sheri Robinson

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommend
customer_reviews.text: I love this. My arthritis is so bad after working some days I can't use the pressure I need to hold a regular can opener together while in use. This thing is amazing. It's so smooth and easy I didn't think it even worked the first time I used it, but sure enuf top came off perfectly. There wasn't any wrestling with the lid where the can opener missed, because the cut was clean and complete. I honestly don't know why ppl are still using the other type when this one is available.
customer_reviews.author: Lirpa

customer_reviews.title: Just works!
customer_reviews.text: This Kuhn Rikon tool is the best can opener ever! The opener never touches the food inside the can (no cross contamination) and the cutter works on pressure needed so it can cut thin cans, thicker cans and all in between without bending the opener like other hand help openers I have had. Electric openers I have used also "lose grip" after opening a thicker can. Not this one! I do not expect to buy another can opener!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: It’s great fun rethinking how to open a can!
customer_reviews.text: I love this quirky can opener! It’s the strangest Can opener I’ve ever owned. To open a can you rotate the handle in a left to right movement. It’s so smooth to turn the handle and the top come off sealed with the side lip of the can. There is no sharp lid to bury in the trash can to keep someone from getting cut! There are several clever tools in the handle to make kitchen chores less challenging too! Great product and hopefully as sturdy as it looks! My grandchildren will love using this! Finally, I’ve got some help in the kitchen!!
customer_reviews.author: delmarvel44

customer_reviews.title: one of my favorite kitchen gadgets of all time
customer_reviews.text: Easiest can opener I ever used, I even taught the little grabber on the side was a waste but now I always use it for the lids. If you ever struggled with opening jars this really helps great leverage for releasing the air so you can remove lids with ease. Can confirm Beer bottle opener WORKS!
customer_reviews.author: Alfredo Reyes Jr.

customer_reviews.title: Solid piece of equipment
customer_reviews.text: It arrived quickly. Can opener is solidly built and has many features. My problem is with opening cans. I have severe arthritis in my hands and just couldn’t seem to be able to open cans. Other family members were able to open cans. It’s a great product, just not for me.
customer_reviews.author: Bob Wilson

customer_reviews.title: THE BEST CAN OPENER
customer_reviews.text: I bought one of these online from a company that ONLY SELLS them at Christmas and loved it. I wanted to give some as gifts through the year and had been looking everywhere for them, I can't tell you how happy I was when I saw them on Amazon. I've tried can openers over the years and there is not one that even comes near to how good these work.!!
customer_reviews.author: KMD

customer_reviews.title: Everything it's cracked up to be!
customer_reviews.text: This opener is a real workhorse! After quite a bit of searching and trying out others, I have finally found "THE ONE". I really just wanted a can opener that actually worked, but this handy-dandy guy goes above and beyond the call of duty. If you have any kind of can, bottle or jar to open, this tool will do it! The can opener could not be easier to use, and it does the job with absolute ease. Two thumbs way up!
customer_reviews.author: Easygoing L. E. Gance

customer_reviews.title: Lasted 4 months opened about 10 cans....
customer_reviews.text: Headline says it all. Nothing appears to be broken. It just no longer opens cans. VERY disappointment. I would pay $100 for a can opener that WORKED more than 6 months.
customer_reviews.author: Matt O

customer_reviews.title: Awesome multi tool.
customer_reviews.text: Makes me wonder why I struggled with multiple kitchen tools when this does so much. Great tool that we've used for more chores than they've listed it could do. We bought it for travel, camping, and our hurricane supplies but it's also become a staple in the kitchen completing everyday tasks. So glad we brought this model vs others we had researched.
customer_reviews.author: Route66Guy

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the money
customer_reviews.text: I was able to get lids off 2 or 3 cans, but then couldn't remove the lid from a couple others. And that was after struggling with rotating the cutter. My wife had great difficulty rotating the handle to cut the lid off. This would be a much better cutter if the ergonomics were better thought out. Maybe the inventor needs to use it him/her self.
customer_reviews.author: D. Eckman

customer_reviews.title: Grateful to have it!
customer_reviews.text: Works well so far. Still trying to find ways of not hurting my wrists while using it but it's the best I've tried so far, without having to go electric. I've used it to open jars, which made them super easy. My process before this item was intense and violent. lol Now, it's calm and simple.
customer_reviews.author: Shoelace19

customer_reviews.title: not the greatest
customer_reviews.text: this item seems to be a bit lower quality then the one it replaced, tends to shred the edge of the cans leaving nasty sharp shreds of metal sticking out even when you are Extra careful. Probably won't buy this style again
customer_reviews.author: 2cat mom

customer_reviews.title: A worthwhile purchase & a good tool.
customer_reviews.text: I bought mine & 2014 and delayed writing a review because I've had other openers that didn't last or stopped working well within a few weeks or months. This one works as well as when i first got it and still looks like new. As some other reviewers have mentioned, it is a good idea to read the instructions. It works a little differently than other openers, but when you follow the instructions it works great!
customer_reviews.author: The Persistently Cynical Optimist

customer_reviews.title: Best can opener ever!
customer_reviews.text: I love this product. I had an older version of this product for seven years until the blade got dull. It still worked just had to rotate the opener more than once. This product is even better. Its everything I need in a can opener and more. I suggest watching the video in the description because it shows how this product is more that just your typical can opener. My favorite function is opening jars. It's so easy. I have arthritis and I can open air tight jars with minimum pain and effort. Worth the cost, hope it lasts as long as my older version did.
customer_reviews.author: red ninja

customer_reviews.title: Good bye sharp lids!
customer_reviews.text: I actually saw this being demonstrated on HSN and found that it was cheaper here on Amazon. I was so impressed by the demo that I immediately threw my old can opener when this arrived; good bye sharp lids! However, this definitely not your old school can opener, there's definitely a learning curve. At first, it was difficult to get it to lock in place, then after one round, it didn't seem like it was doing anything, then it was hard to unlock. After a few tries, I got the hang of it and it has become one of my favorite kitchen tools!
customer_reviews.author: Nick

customer_reviews.title: I really like the can opener
customer_reviews.text: I really like the can opener. It's easy to turn and gets the can open the first time around. The jar opener doesn't work right. I have an old jar opener from Pampered Chef and like it because it really does relieve the pressure and allows for easy opening. I can't get this one to work. However, the price has gone up since I bought it. I'm not sure it's worth $20.
customer_reviews.author: Angi K

customer_reviews.title: Worlds Best Can Opener
customer_reviews.text: I have been searching for a good can opener for years, and finally found it! Be a lefty and having rather weak hands, it has been a challenge finding one that meets my needs. I wanted one that cuts the cans leaving no sharp edges too. The Kuhn Rikon never gets gunky because the blade never touches the contents. The little bird beak mechanism easily lifts the lid right off... This is the perfect can opener and I am so thankful I finally found it!!!
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth D.

customer_reviews.title: Great product as long as you FOLLOW DIRECTIONS
customer_reviews.text: This is a great multi-tasker for the kitchen. The bottle opener and cap twist are nice touches, but the main purpose is what it excels at! It quite easily separates the lid from the can with smooth edges every time. Just follow the directions and only go around the can ONCE. The other reviews on here talking about metal shavings are because they ignored this and continued to cut into the can after it was already open. You will feel when the lid releases, then just wind the handle back a quarter turn to disengage the opener. Then just use the little pincer to remove the lid. I'm never going back to a traditional opener again.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron Snyder

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely awesome.
customer_reviews.text: Definitely going to say this is one of my favourite things I've bought for my kitchen recently. The convenience of having all opening tools in one easy to use tool is one of its strong selling points. At first, I was worried it wouldn't work on some cans, but I have yet to find a can that it doesn't work on. Would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Ryland

customer_reviews.title: Not safe to use.
customer_reviews.text: First I used this I got metal shavings. Need I say more.
customer_reviews.author: jimmy burkholder

customer_reviews.title: How did I ever live without this? You'll wonder the same.
customer_reviews.text: Gift this to everyone you know! I'm impressed with all the things this can do. So grateful. As a widow with arthritis this is exactly what I needed in so many ways. There hasn't been a can or jar that I haven't been able to open. You'll be so glad you have this great invention. You'll just wished they thought of it sooner.
customer_reviews.author: C. Sanders

customer_reviews.title: Less cleanup, no sharp edges
customer_reviews.text: Works as advertised, cuts the top as a 'lid' that you can peel off the can. No sharp edges and no getting food gunk into the gears of a traditional can opener. It's slightly longer and larger which provides better grip. Built in "clamp" to get the cut 'lid' off the can. Used a few times now and works great.
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Can Opener
customer_reviews.text: Does a great job and doesn’t get yucky like traditional can openers. Unlikely a person could get cut from the can, too. Good for those with dexterity issues. Mentally it is so different than the traditional openers, so it seems to be strange with a little learning curve, but in no time it is ideal.
customer_reviews.author: LMT-G

customer_reviews.title: This might actually last me!
customer_reviews.text: In my house, we go through two or three can openers a year. We have tried so many different brands and for the life of me, I can't figure out why we are constantly breaking them. I actually have faith that this will last more than a couple of months! It did take a few uses to get accustomed to how it works BUT it is a can-opener so you'll figure it out! This might seem strange, but it's a pleasure to use. PLUS, no sharp lids. I would order again but hopefully not for another year :D UPDATE- two years later and works like new!
customer_reviews.author: coli-johns

customer_reviews.title: Nice little Swiss Army Knife!
customer_reviews.text: I'm experimenting with can openers since it's so hard to find a decent one these days, and this one has been excellent. Of course that is only so far and it may yet wear out like the others (remind me to update next year!) but I like not having sharp edges and this thing works great. Even if it does wear out I might keep it for the other features - it's a kind of Swiss Army Knife among openers, does cans, bottles, jars, the works.
customer_reviews.author: *~Stella~*

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use and hold.
customer_reviews.text: Having used this type years ago, I was expecting this one to be a bit tricky to affix to a can. Nope. Slipped right on, and with a slight twist of the Turner it latched right on to the can. Much easier to use than expected. Also has lots of extra useful tools. Large size, easy to hold.
customer_reviews.author: Annonymous

customer_reviews.title: Exceeded expectations
customer_reviews.text: I was a little hesitant about how this would work given the minimalist design, but at first use I was sold. The slim design appealed to me since I have limited drawer space so I took a shot. It’s so easy to use as the gears lock into place automatically as you start turning the lever. One round around the can does the trick and the trigger operates teeth built into the side of the opener make lifting off the lid easy and mess free. The bottle at the opposite end is a nice addition too.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Wichern

customer_reviews.title: Open up a can of whoop ass
customer_reviews.text: I must have had four different can openers before this glorious one. They all broke. I thought I would give this one a shot. It’s different and is pretty big. Most durable and efficient can opener I have owned...finally!!
customer_reviews.author: Julia Ballesteros

customer_reviews.title: Best Can Opener I Ever Bought
customer_reviews.text: Finally, a can opener that doesn't rust! I used to go through can openers at a ridiculous rate - they were constantly getting rusty and becoming unusable. I've had this one for months, and it's still in fabulous condition. The secret is the fact that this doesn't cut the lid out from the frame of the can, but lifts the entire top layer of the can off, so the can opener never comes in contact with the contents of the can. An added plus: no sharp edges you need to keep away from kids.
customer_reviews.author: B. G .

customer_reviews.title: This is a WOW!
customer_reviews.text: This is a perfect can opener. I'm glad I didn't pay attention to the negative reviews. Just put it on the can lid and it "catches" right away. Turn the crank to open the can, use the "pincher" to remove the lid and that's it. I am terrible with figuring out how things work but I had no trouble at all with this. I'm so glad I bought it!
customer_reviews.author: Shop Gal

customer_reviews.title: My fav kitchen gadget
customer_reviews.text: I have spent many many dollars on cheap can openers until I found this one. This is awesome. My first thoughts like most of you who saw the price is that we can find something way cheaper- but trust me they are cheaper for a reason. This opener leaves clean edges that do not cut you and you can fit the lid back on. On the other side it has a pull for cans that have the lift up and pop attachment. My toddler also can use this and I am not worried that it will hurt him, because it will not.
customer_reviews.author: prassanna

customer_reviews.title: Safe and effective
customer_reviews.text: This thing is so cool! Ever since I gashed my finger on an open can as a kid, I’ve hated using traditional can openers. This opener has enabled me to conquer my fear! The first time I used it I wasn’t sure it had even worked because the can still looked closed. But then I discovered the little pinchers on the side of the device, used them to pinch the edge of the can lid, and it lifted right off to reveal smooth, non-finger-gashing edges! Definitely recommend.
customer_reviews.author: ShoSho

customer_reviews.title: Much better than the expensive OXO can opener I got a while back
customer_reviews.text: Like it it's much better than 2 others I tried. One was the OXO side cutting opener and it sucked and cost to much. But my best side cut can opener is till my Good Cook cheapy one. It does not last more than a few years but at that price and the fact that it actually works the Good cook can opener is still my go to model.
customer_reviews.author: Jack (NMI) Stecker

customer_reviews.title: It works on ALL cans!
customer_reviews.text: My former can opener was making a mess of opening cans--ever normal round cans like soup or vegetables. This opener works like a charm, leaves no ragged edges and doesn't dip into the contents of the can. The handle does turn a little more stiffly than I would choose, but not bad. Overall I like the opener a lot.
customer_reviews.author: Incognito

customer_reviews.title: Best can opened EVER!!
customer_reviews.text: I've gone through more can openers than I care to remember. Many were bad from the start, others eventually failed. I've had this one for three years and it has never failed once. No fiddling about trying to line up the cutting wheels. It does that itself. All you need do is twist the handle. When done, twist the handle counter clockwise a tad and it releases. A handy "claw" pulls the lid off a nice, safe open can. The handle is sturdy, easy to grip, and easy to turn. After decades of disappointments with every configuration of manual and electric can openers, I finally found THE ONE!!
customer_reviews.author: The Godfather

customer_reviews.title: Better than conventional openers
customer_reviews.text: Have 2 of the more conventional openers the punctures the top of the can and then proceeds to cut the lid in a manner that leaves a jagged lid. This Kuhn Rikon is my first opener of this type and must say that I'm impressed at how it removes the top of the can with no metal slivers. Will be my go to can opener from now on.
customer_reviews.author: Stan N.

customer_reviews.title: It doesn't work
customer_reviews.text: I liked the idea of this can opener, but it doesn't work. All it does is score the can and produce metal flakes which could end up in my food. So unsafe. I gave it time. I tried different cans. I am sure now that this 'technology' doesn't work and I am surprised this product has so many positive reviews.
customer_reviews.author: L. S.

customer_reviews.title: I literally bought this to open Topo Chico
customer_reviews.text: My Martha Stewart can opener we got as a wedding gift 8 years ago finally kicked the bucket. I've recently developed a fondness to the wonderful sparkling water of Topo Chico and was tired of using the crappy bottle opener on my keychain so I killed two birds with one stone. This can opener is awesome.
customer_reviews.author: Parker Cook

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: This is great- I originally wanted a Pampered Chef opener, but couldn’t get one easily enough. This is equally as wonderful. Only thing I wish could be improved is that you can’t tel when you’ve made it all the way around- if you’re not paying attention you may go around twice! Lol
customer_reviews.author: AW

customer_reviews.title: Best can opener!
customer_reviews.text: Hands-down, the best can opener I've ever owned. It's like the Swiss knife of openers...does everything! Tiny bit of a learning curve, but once you figure it out, you'll see you can easily cut the lid (no jagged edges to cut yourself on), remove it with the pincher, even rinse it off with the pitcher and ditch it into recycling without getting your hands wet! So smooth and easy to turn too. Have had for several months now and absolutely love it!
customer_reviews.author: Julie B

customer_reviews.title: FANTASTIC and Great for Left-handed Folks!
customer_reviews.text: This is an awesome, well-built and very versatile tool; every kitchen should have one. It works as advertised in every way...and we especially like the way the can opener works as it leaves no sharp edges. IMPORTANT: This tool is great for left handed folks too because the can is opened from the top vs. on the side like standard hand-cranked can openers.
customer_reviews.author: Drummond Farms

customer_reviews.title: Just what I was looking for
customer_reviews.text: Just got this. I bought this primarily to open tabs on cans. It works great! I am sure I'll be using many of the other features as well. Great buy.
customer_reviews.author: Karen

customer_reviews.title: Great can opener!
customer_reviews.text: I never thought I could be so impressed with a can opener. It's solid, reliable, and works great on all types of containers. My dad laughed at me when I bought it (4 x the price of a basic crappy opener, he said), but he loves the damn thing as much as I do now.
customer_reviews.author: James UTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: Why don't all can openers work this way?
customer_reviews.text: This thing works amazingly well. It took me a couple minutes to figure out how it was supposed to work, because I'm a dummy, and I don't read manuals. Even after I figure out how the thing worked, I still have trouble believing it works. It's that much of a difference from a normal can opener. Why all can opener's didn't work this way from the beginning of canned food, I don't know.
customer_reviews.author: Nels N. Nelson

customer_reviews.title: Very pleased
customer_reviews.text: I was a little skeptical of the high price at first, but after reading the high reviews, I went ahead and purchased it. I have 0 regrets about splurging on this item. My wife wasn't sold until she couldn't open a bottle of cherry grenadine because it had been sealed shut by the sugary substance. This little green machine got it open in a second with no hesitation.
customer_reviews.author: Erai88

customer_reviews.title: Mostly very good can opener
customer_reviews.text: For smaller cans, this works better than anything I've yet seen, short of an expensive electric can opener. Nice build quality, not too heavy, easy to clean, clean cutting. Cons are For restaurant-sized lids such as 8 inches in diameter, it requires quite a bit of muscle to turn.. If you go past the place you started opening on the lid, it may leave metal shards on the can.
customer_reviews.author: Herbert Hoover

customer_reviews.title: A great tool.
customer_reviews.text: I never used a manual can opener as my main opener. There was always one available, but exclusively as a back up. Although it does require a bit of practice, once the needed technique is mastered, it is consistently effective and a pleasure to use. I recommend it highly.
customer_reviews.author: Arnie

customer_reviews.title: Just buy it and open cans!
customer_reviews.text: We looked for a can opener that worked for years to no avail. This one ended our search and then some. The can opener is great, but the jar seal breaker is almost as exciting. This is one well thought out kitchen tool. Very pleased with the purchase!
customer_reviews.author: Buyer

customer_reviews.title: Best manual can opener
customer_reviews.text: I needed a new can opener because my electric opener went "caput." I was looking at Kuhn Rikon's Master Opener. When I read some of the reviews, I hesitated a little because some rewievers stated that there was some difficulty in its operation. Well, I decided to purchase it with the thought that, "I can always return it" if it is not to my satisfaction. It is the best, well-engineered can opener ever. I am an elderly person and, for me, it's very easy to operate. I have no negatives about it at all.G I am very glad that I decided to buy it. I highly recommend this product. erika, PA
customer_reviews.author: erika

customer_reviews.title: Kuhn Rikon Opener Works!
customer_reviews.text: We like a can opener that leaves smooth edges. This opener is perfect. Previous openers that worked the same way would bend while opening. This opener does not bend and easily opens the cans. The flip top opener built into the handle to open aluminum cans with a pull top like soda cans a snap. My wife no longer has to have her manicured nails repaired.
customer_reviews.author: Middle

customer_reviews.title: works great
customer_reviews.text: It's slightly harder to turn the knob with your left hand, but still do-able. Works exactly as advertised. It's easy to turn, easy to pull lids off with. I'd rather use this than a pull top on a can. No sharp edges, doesn't take a ton of effort to use, and I have used some AWFUL can openers. It is a little bit bigger than I expected.
customer_reviews.author: Felix

customer_reviews.title: Not as long lasting as conventional ones
customer_reviews.text: It's worked well and I do like that the way it removes the star. I'm removing a star because the blade has dulled. It's been 5 years since I bought it. That's good in that it didn't come out of the box. That's bad in that I don't open more than a can or two a week. I remember the old fashioned ones my mom had lasting decades. I'll probably go back to those. I've only ever cut myself once on a can
customer_reviews.author: A Mates

customer_reviews.title: Best can opener I’ve used
customer_reviews.text: The best can opener I ever bought. I’ve gotten tired of my can openers always crapping out after a while and won’t open any cans anymore. I looked into any different kind of bottle openers and I found this one. It opens the can completely different and it’s still working after a while now just as I got it. Super easy and fast to open cans and it completely removes the lid which I would never thought would make such a big difference but I can’t go back to a conventional can opener now.
customer_reviews.author: Victor V.

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use and week made
customer_reviews.text: I needed help with opening soda bottles and cans due to surgery to fix my broken wrist (very hard to do with one hand LOL). Many years ago (at least 10) I purchased a Kuhn Rikon regular safety can opener and found it to be well made and easy to use. So while shopping on Amazon looking for something just to help open bottles I came across this and what a Godsend. Not only could I open my soda I could open a soup can with the “hook”. This brand is a little pricey but well worth every penny.
customer_reviews.author: Samsprincess

customer_reviews.title: Yes! Buy it!!
customer_reviews.text: This is the best and easiest can opener I have ever used! Thank you for such a wonderful product!
customer_reviews.author: Lyra108

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: It took watching a video to see how it works (it was recommended on a Facebook page, so I hadn't seen a demo when I bought it), but I love it now. In fact, I just used it a few minutes ago. I like that it has the pull tab hook and not having the top fall into my food when I open the can. It's a hefty weight without being too heavy; it just feels like it will last a long time.
customer_reviews.author: Della

customer_reviews.title: Quit working after the third can!
customer_reviews.text: Looked great and worked for the first three cans. Took it out to open another can a few weeks later and it would not seat on the can lip or open it. Tried several more; would not open any; large, small, it didn't matter. Unfortunately I'm just a few days over the return deadline. I'm stuck with an oversized bottle opener. Amazon should drop this product!
customer_reviews.author: Reteach

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: After seeing Youtube hacks on how to open cans without the traditional can opener, I just knew someone would have invented a device like this. I searched through several different variants on Amazon and decided on this. After you've figured out how it works, this device is pretty great. I use it to open all canned goods I have and no longer need to worry about slicking my hand/fingers on any sharp edges with the older can opener I had. I also like a few of the other features added it although I haven't used them as much as the can opener feature but still handy to have on a single device.
customer_reviews.author: AJ776523

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't work, junk
customer_reviews.text: I got this to replace my 15 year old Pampered Chef can opener that finally bit the dust. With this one - I have to go around my cans 3 times to get them to open, or it leaves parts connected, and if I try to take the lid off, it snaps back and spills liquid. It leaves tiny metal slivers around the edge. Perhaps mine was a bad batch, but it's been total junk for me.
customer_reviews.author: Frazzle

customer_reviews.title: Great quality, easy to use, very useful
customer_reviews.text: Replaced our rusting, old classic can opener with this after it failed to grip the can properly anymore. Great purchase, easier than I thought to use, and its great that it's a safe, non-sharp edge and since there's no contact with the contents it doesn't need additional washing for that gross grime buildup like standard can openers. I'm a sucker for multi-tool items and this one comes with other useful things for the kitchen.
customer_reviews.author: mr. e

customer_reviews.title: Really like this
customer_reviews.text: My family had a hard time figuring out how to use it. I really like it. The lid comes off with no sharp edges but sometimes you have to use a knife or something to pop the lid off. I wish it had a puncture type can opener .
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: One of the best purchases I have made on Amazon
customer_reviews.text: I balked at the price when I first saw this, but if you are paring down, this is many tools in one, looks attractive, is highly functional, as well as easy to use. I am showing all my friends this and I love it. Thank you.
customer_reviews.author: Ann

customer_reviews.title: Very durable and easy to use
customer_reviews.text: I can't speak to how long it lasts, but i'll update this review if I feel it stops working prematurely. It is very easy to use (once you figure out how to use it) and very durable. I wish I had gone with this about 10 can openers ago.
customer_reviews.author: roboticsguy1988

customer_reviews.title: Reliable + Less Clutter
customer_reviews.text: I am a huge fan of multifunctional products. I love that this product does each of the indicated tasks as good or better than the respective products it imitates. If you are looking for one product to fulfil all of the roles that were indicated in the description, then you need look no further. Buy this product and feel free to rid your drawer of the unnecessary clutter.
customer_reviews.author: JL

customer_reviews.title: My last can opener, perhap forever.
customer_reviews.text: We've had this one for a year or two. We generally only use it for opening cans. It's perfect. No more dangerous sharp edges. It grabs on, holds tight, and you feel a slight release when it's job is done. 100% accuracy every time. Would say more, but it's just a can opener. Wish more "stuff" were designed and made for function as this item is.
customer_reviews.author: L. M. Brown

customer_reviews.title: Amazing! I'm usually not very excited about kitchen gadgets
customer_reviews.text: Amazing! I'm usually not very excited about kitchen gadgets, but this one is brilliant. The only problem is that after you latch it on and turn it around one complete time it doesn't even seem like the lid is off. But grab the lid with the "beak" and lift and there it is. Perfectly removed with no sharp edges. The other end is great for pull tops, pop tops, beer bottles and two-liter pop bottles.
customer_reviews.author: Bruce Kelly

customer_reviews.title: Not useful for any but small, thin-metal cans.
customer_reviews.text: This thing is actually painful to use as a can opener, and will not cut through the lid on anything other than small cans made of thin metal. Operating it is straightforward enough; it just doesn't do the job. The lid lifter is also a completely flimsy piece of junk. The tab lifter and bottle opener portions are fine, but if it's a can opener you're looking for, and you don't have young, very strong hands and a high pain tolerance and expect to open more than maybe one can of tuna a year, keep looking.
customer_reviews.author: citikit

customer_reviews.title: The Swiss Army Knife of Can Openers
customer_reviews.text: I tried all the different built in functions, even the jar lid helper. Each function could be in a seperate tool for a few dollars. They all come free with this unit. And opening cans? Even my 15 yr old is impressed. He works hard to hide that about almost everything. Last night he picked up a can and did a mock sales pitch running his hand over the newly opened can to demo the safety. If you have little ones roaming about, this tool is a MUST! Why risk a nasty cut on a can you opened and forgot on the counter?
customer_reviews.author: David James

customer_reviews.title: Faulty product, no refund
customer_reviews.text: This auto can opener is disappointing to me. Nothing in the description is correct. It never worked, not once. Worse case I will suffer a loss from this purchase as refund is not posible without item being returned. That I understand greatly but there should be exceptions to the rules. So now I will need to research for a good auto can opener once more.
customer_reviews.author: Dee

customer_reviews.title: Well thought out can opener
customer_reviews.text: My old can opener was looking pretty beat up so I decided to give this a shot. I have to say I love the way it opens cans around the perimeter without any sharp edges. It's a well thought out tool with several functions built in. Glad I bought it and feel that it will last many years to come.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Look elsewhere for easy to use tool
customer_reviews.text: Might be okay for younger people but not okay for weaker elderly like me.it takes a lot of force to turn the can opener knob. The tab can opener end slipped out of the tab. The little pincher part grabbed the can lid just right. Over all It's larger than I think it needs to be , not easy for me to hold.
customer_reviews.author: Ken

customer_reviews.title: Brilliant!
customer_reviews.text: Okay - this is revolutionary! So you use this small item and you end up with USEFUL cans! You can even use the tops as a tupperware lid in the fridge for half-full bits. You can use the cans for storing pencils and pens. (highly recommend pineapple juice cans for holding colored pencils!) No sharp edges as it cuts on the side of the top rim! You do have to be mindful of the end of the circle round. If you go over where you already cut by much, it can make a tiny nub there, but just watch it and no worries. Brilliant! Threw away the old-style one.
customer_reviews.author: Beth A. Swan

customer_reviews.title: Works Perfectly
customer_reviews.text: This is easily the best can opener that I've ever owned in my 60+ year. Turning the knob to the right tightens the opener down on the side of a can and then cuts the lid off. Turning the knob to the left releases the can. Finally there is a bird beak like device on the side to lift the lid off the can. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: DangFineGuy

customer_reviews.title: Best can opener - Great for right or left hand use!
customer_reviews.text: My daughter found this can opener first and told me about it. I've had a pampered chef one for years but is has been a bit finicky. I finally decided to order this one and give it a try. She was right! This can opener is very smooth and easy to use. And best of all, anyone can use it - left or right handed.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle

product_meta.title: Kuhn Rikon Auto Safety Master Opener for Cans, Bottles and Jars, 9 x 2.75 inches, Black
product_meta.description: Color:BlackA genuine all-rounder, the Swiss-designed 5-in-1 Auto Safety Master Opener from Kuhn Rikon is also a space-saver - open everything within the kitchen using a single gadget rather than needing multiple gadgets. Famed for its versatility, it incorporates a different opening mechanism for standard and ring-pull cans/tins, crown-cap (beer-style) bottles, screw-top (PET) bottles and jars. Suitable for all, including those with limited strength/mobility in their hands/wrists, the opener possesses a number of ingenious features that allow it to excel when dealing with cans/tins.
feature_bullets: Five separate opener functions within a single gadget - open standard and ring-pull cans/tins, crown-cap (beer-style) bottles, screw-top (PET) bottles and jars with ease
Automatically attaches via ‘lock-on’ technology that grips the lid (no need to clamp it on) and long handle provides extra grip/leverage

Designed to be safe (opens cans/tins without cutting the metal, which leaves no sharp edges on the rim or lid) and to prevent cross-contamination/maximise hygiene (opener doesn’t make contact with the contents of the can/tin)
Lids are removed via mini-pliers/pincers once opened (no need to handle) - watch the video to see the Auto Safety Master Opener in action
Easy to clean (wipe with a damp cloth; don’t put in the dishwasher). Dimensions: 9 (L) x 2. 75 (W) x 2. 75 (H) inches

specifications.Domestic Shipping: Item can be shipped within U.S.
specifications.International Shipping: This item can be shipped to select countries outside of the U.S. Learn More
specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.6 out of 5 stars3,454 ratings4.6 out of 5 stars
